Title: Laden Pioneer LNG tanker enters Suez Canal, headed southward
Description: Kpler's data science team confirmed on satellite image that the sanctioned 138,000 m3 Pioneer LNG tanker entered the Suez Canal yesterday, travelling southbound, around a month after completing an alleged ship-to-ship transfer with the 150,000 m3 New Energy LNG tanker.
Author: JS

Title: UK slaps sanctions on five ships linked to Arctic LNG 2
Description: The UK has slapped sanctions on five LNG tankers and two associated entities involved in the shipping of LNG from the sanctioned 19.8 mtpa Arctic LNG plant in Russia, tightening the ring of sanctions on the project.
Author: JS

Title: Vasant 1 FSRU still disconnected from Turkey’s Saros LNG terminal; sale to Botas approved
Description: Shareholders of India’s Swan Energy recently voted to approve the sale of its 180,000 m3 Vasant 1 floating storage regasification unit to Turkey’s state-owned energy firm Botas, suggesting that the FSRU could soon be reinstalled at the Botas-operated Saros LNG terminal after idling in Saros Bay for months.
Author: CK

Title: Harbour Energy issues its first LNG tender, offers one Snohvit cargo
Description: London-based oil and gas firm Harbour Energy has issued its first LNG tender and is offering one cargo that will load at the Equinor-operated 4.2 mtpa Hammerfest LNG plant on Norway’s  Melkoya Island from Nov. 15-18. The tender closes on Oct. 3.
Author: CK
